name: jamers
text: When I read this I imagined Freeman reading his article aloud. Largely nonsense made me spit iced tea on my monitor because I couldn't stop laughing. I need to learn to not drink anything while reading achewood.

name: davidadam
text: Hell yeah man. I was about to post something like "try to read that article without imagining Freeman's voice. You can't." but you essentially said it for me.

name: wehavemagnums
text: "Anymore, that is" is perfect Freeman.

name: hyetal
text: You keep saying "Freeman," I keep thinking "Gordon."

name: anticitizen
text:
I reread the excerpt and tried to imagine Gordon Freeman reading it aloud but all I heard was pained yelps and guttural mumblings.

I kid, but seriously he talks not so good.

name: dusty
text: Why would he need to talk when he can just stare and people know what he wants?

name: soticoto
text:
Gordon Freeman would not write an article.
Gordon Freeman would jump, run and climb across the country on foot and HIT that tostada with a crowbar.

name: terriblerobot
text: And a small box of ammo would appear.

name: norrin
text: Onstad is a master at capturing other people's speach patterns.

name: falseprophet
text: I remember when I first met Andy...

name: soticoto
text: Chubby for Shawshank.

name: falseprophet
text: A comment left by falseprophet was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Marcus_Brody, eddylee, AtlanticCity)

name: scorpio_nadir
text: You got that Morgan Freeman inflection of "seems almost-like-irony but actually the farthest thing from it" in 'remember' just right.

name: dybrar
text: I just chubbied this only to realise, belatedly, that it probably wasn't an Oregon Trail reference at all!

name: soticoto
text: ... I thought I made what it was a reference to rather clear.

name: mugi
text: Seriously. He's got all of those authors down perfectly.

name: pogo
text: He's the Mark Twain of cartoonists.

name: lordpretzel
text:
[IMGS OFF]

Good news everyone! I've invented a device that makes you hear this text read in my voice!

name: dmaster
text: chubbs my good man

name: lolsworth
text: It is literally impossible.

name: aaron_haynes
text: Not entirely nonsense. He's not willing to completely dismiss them, because of his love for tostadas. But things were better once.

name: unquotable
text: I really, truly want to read the rest of that article. I NEED TO KNOW WHAT HE THINKS.

name: theryuujin
text: Largely Nonsense!

name: theryuujin
text: i see you tragic_johnson. i see your profile .

name: vheissu
text: That could be early signs of Freemanic Paracusia. You better get that checked out.

name: kaithekender
text:
Yeah I did too

The man really IS in everything

name: duperando
text:
Good lord, I know I already have commented on this, but I am pretty sure this is my favorite achewood of all time. It's just so perfect.
Tostadas magazine is no-nonesense. And you know it's legit if celebrities like morgan freeman weigh in. I'd read that 'zine over Reader's Digest any day.

name: a_dude
text: Morgan Freeman can make hella tostadas.

name: hellofyellin
text: When speaking of tostadas, Freeman comes raw.  He comes loud.  That is how Freeman rolls.

name: soticoto
text:
Morgan Freeman is God.


.... Or at least he is god when Alanis Morissette isn't.

name: i_love_kate
text: I'm guessing from your lack of lames that everyone here has seen the film Dogma. On your behalf, "Phew"!

name: vermy
text:
A socicoto asset I won't lame.
This is totally a Thing.

name: soticoto
text: Glad to see you judge a comment for the comment and not the one who posts it.

name: epicurus
text: I wonder what it would cost for a recording of Freeman reading this? Not that you really need it.

name: vermy
text: But you do. You do.

name: hollis
text: I believe I will start calling my friends "hometicket" now.

name: woodenteeth
text: I also enjoy "homeslice".

name: djwhiterabbit
text:
it's truly eerie how chris onstad can capture the feel of morgan freeman's speaking/voice-over style so accurately.

that monologue could've easily been dropped into shawshank redemption without sounding an iota out of place. (^ ^,)

name: straw
text: Morgan Freeman can not believe tostadas these days.  He can't.

name: juancarlos
text: A comment left by juancarlos was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by rolotonybrowntown, usversusthem, anitrophaeron, aperson)

name: zefiel
text: ..That was.. confusing. I- I think i need to go lie down for a bit now.

name: rotating-dog
text: Sadly, magazines like this do exist. When I sell them I react pretty much like Teodor in panel 3. The best? Stationary Engine Driver The world always needs someone who will buy magazines about stationary engines. Or tostadas.

name: honesttom
text:
I worked in a law firm that dealt with construction, we used to get loads of "how-do-they-fill-this-every-month" magazines. I think my favourite was Reinforced Concrete Digest.

Actually, if that title was literal, I'd probably buy it.

name: pa_ass_nts
text: I have heard tell of a Modern Drunkard magazine. Is that really a niche that needed exploiting?

name: chuchurocket
text: actually i've read it, online at least.  it's largely satirical, not too bad.

name: rotating-dog
text: I can't believe satire these days.

name: stubob
text: I actually subscribed to that one! Great stuff.  The only problem is the semi-random time between issues due to the drunken staff.  What I'm curious about.. is there a magazine about moustaches? Or about living in a van?

name: tekende
text: A magazine about facial hair would be awesome.

name: gormster
text: Mo Monthly.

name: pogo
text: Sadly?  These niche publications provide a needed service and forum for industries that put dinner on the table, rotating-dog.  Do you live off some sort of trust fund?

name: tekende
text: I like how "rotating-dog" kind of sounds like maybe it is an insult. But it is just his name.

name: fineoakstructure
text: Wow...I gave this one a 5 for the surprise factor.  I remember reading it this earlier this year and not being impressed, but revisiting it after I'd started reading message boards again for the first time in year, lines like "a lot of people are calling bullshit..." and "word on the boards is that..." just seem spot on pathetically funny.  plus hometicket.

name: droplede
text: Easy Eater -- that's his name.

name: sabata00
text: largely and nonsense are the best two words ever to be put side by side

name: presterjohn
text: The humble local newspaper is going the way of the passenger pigeon. Meanwhile, the glossy magazine, a whoreson base medium if ever there was one, is thriving. Truly a sad state of affairs. Cornelius would back me up on this one.

name: professorhazard
text:
I no like'a the tostada. When I am younger, sure, ok, but not so much now.

Maybe I change, maybe they change. Who knows?

name: slalvation
text: What I love about Morgan Freeman's tostada opinion is how much it sounds like everyone who cares about something really mundane.

name: boredom_man
text: Wet split beaver shots these days? Largely nonsense.

name: dusty
text: We loved that sauce.

name: drago25
text: Morgan Freeman is apparently now not only turning up in every second film, but magazine as well.

name: hobit
text: this strip should have a possible sixth star.  thats how good it is

name: tonyhighwind
text:
"Largely nonsense."

Imminently quotable.

name: indoorsman
text: What does he not have a hundred of? I MUST know.

name: thechops
text:
Yeah holy shit, that is one bullshit tostada that's a taco salad.

Tostadas are where a person learns how to eat with control.

name: duperando
text: Morgan Freeman. Morgan Freeman . Effing hilarious.

name: roint
text: There was a few Calvin and Hobbes strips about a magazine Calvin subscribed to called "Chewing", which was all about bubble gum and included tests to determine the correct type of gum for your saliva pH and so forth. This makes for a nice addition to the small but proud canon of comic strips that satirize special interest magazines.

name: madisonsquare
text: You don't say!

name: scifigrl47
text:
He DOES say!

Oh, no, wait. You were right. He don't. Sorry!
